revised_title: Symbolic Representation of Directed Magnitude Translation in Physics
tldr: The author introduces a new symbolic representation for the translation of directed magnitudes, such as force, velocity, and displacement. They propose representing the translation of a directed magnitude by a product and apply this concept to the proof of the Parallelogram of Forces and the determination of the effect of forces on a rigid body. This approach allows for a more efficient and concise representation of statics principles.
